subject: Re: [junit] Re: asking for comments about a doc introducing Junit
msgSnippet: well, i guess choice is always a good thing to have,there is no the one and only primer ,if you get what i mean. I read your article,pretty useful, i must
messageBody:
well, i guess choice is always a good thing to have,there is no "the one and
only primer" ,if you get what i mean.
I read your article,pretty useful, i must say,except that people find it
easier to read prose than code,even if most of the code is comment. I guess
smaller examples would be better received..

jus' my 2 cents...err..rupees.

ciao

----- Original Message -----
From: "garnierjm" <garnierjm@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, January 25, 2002 7:15 PM
Subject: [junit] Re: asking for comments about a doc introducing Junit


> I reply to my own post ...
>
> I did not know the article
> http://www.clarkware.com/articles/JUnitPrimer.html
> whose adress was given in the message Re: How to start with Junit
> (http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/3881)
>
> I have to admit that this article is quite good and more clear than
> mine. So, don't loose your time to criticize mine.
>
> Bests Regards, Jean-Michel
